alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 4:26PM MDT until July 24 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated rain continues in the warning area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen, and additional rainfall amounts up to a quarter inch are possible in the warned area. Earlier flash flooding in The Retreat and on Buckhorn Road has begun to subside. Flood waters will continue to diminish over the next hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southeast portion of the Cameron Peak Burn Area. This includes the following additional locations... Box Prairie, Upper Buckhorn along County Road 44H, Moondance Way, Stringtown Gulch, Crystal Mountain, The Retreat and Storm Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded roadways, and beware of rock slides and debris flows causing travel hazards. Heavy Rainfall has caused flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
